intro: Cacalia oligatodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and have a slight hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cacalia oligatodes is typically found in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in cooler climates.
